sessions.title: Student Arrival & Check-In
sessions.longDescription: Upon arrival at lobby of 120 S Riverside, the Ulta team will assist you in navigating up to our office on the 15th floor.

sessions.title: Welcome
sessions.longDescription:
The phrase “it takes a village” is one that gets used in many different contexts to describe a complex endeavor and the creation of a large scale mobile app is no exception. The goal of today’s “Day of Code” event is two-fold.

First, we want to supply you all with key insights into iOS development best practices that you can use going forward.

Second, we want to introduce you to the many teams and team members that make up the “village” that works on the Ulta Beauty apps.
takeaways: To build an application deployed at scale, it involves a team of cross-functional collaborators, not just developers
Many of you may end up working as a developer, but there are also many essential complimentary roles that are in the app development field
Almost every company has some level of need for app development resources, so cast the net of your job search far & wide
Like what you do or you won't like doing it. Have fun!

sessions.title: Company Overview
sessions.shortDescription: A brief overview of Ulta Beauty. The company, our mission, and vision.
sessions.longDescription:
We're on a quest to bring the fun side of beauty to all—constantly delighting our guests with All Things Beauty, All in One Place™ while offering rewarding careers for our passionate, beauty-loving associates.

Our Vision: To be the most-loved beauty destination of our guests and the most-admired retailer by our Ulta Beauty associates, communities, partners and investors.

Our Mission: Every day we use the power of beauty to bring to life the possibilities that lie within each of us – inspiring every guest and enabling each associate to build a fulfilling career.
takeaways: All Things Beauty. All in One Place.
A salon in every store
Growth in both retail and digital channels
The possibilities are beautiful

sessions.title: Gathering Requirements & UX
sessions.longDescription: We’ll show you the methodology behind creating fun, user-friendly interfaces and experiences, plus you’ll participate in a quick UX workshop where you can flex your user-centric skills!
takeaways: To make sure what you create meets the user’s needs: Research, Design, Prototype, Test, Repeat!
User experience extends beyond the screen; consider the full end-to-end experience
Get to know your user through interviews, surveys, card sorting, personas, and usability testing
Don’t design alone! Collaborate as a team with brainstorms, working sessions, and design reviews
Design for ease of use: limit taps/clicks, ensure text is readable, use simple & visible navigation, etc.
Prototype and user test early and often: you can start with a paper sketch!
User test your design before you code; apply the results and test again

sessions.title: Designing for Mobile Applications
sessions.longDescription: Walkthrough of designing for iOS applications, including: design process and tools, creating comps, approval process and exporting for developers.
takeaways: Design at 1x
Typically assets are exported for iOS @ 1x, 2x and 3x
Vector graphics are resolution independent
PDF format on iOS for vector assets
Raster graphics are resolution dependent
PNG format on iOS for raster assets

sessions.title: Welcome to Xcode
sessions.longDescription:
I will be introducing you to your new best friend for everything on the Apple side of development, Xcode.

You should be able to find your way around the Xcode interface after my session. From the navigation pane, to the main code editor, and through the debug panel.
takeaways: Playgrounds are a good place to try new ideas
Navigator is where you can find your classes and assets
The Editor is where you do the majority or work, whether it is code or Interface builder
The Utilities Panel is where you can set fine details for items in the project
The debugging area contains all relevant information about the running app

sessions.title: Web Services & Data Models
sessions.longDescription: A software development kit (SDK or devkit) is typically a set of software development tools that allows the creation of applications for a certain software package, software framework, hardware platform, computer system, video game console, operating system, or similar development platform.
takeaways: Ensure you have a technical contract with your vendor partners
When in doubt, version your API
A few lines of code, does not mean its simple
Hold your development vendors to your same high standards

sessions.title: Break
sessions.longDescription:
Please take this opportunity to stretch your legs, use the bathroom, and grab some pizza for lunch. One of our team members will be available to direct you to the nearest bathroom.

The Ulta team is also available for any questions that you might have from the morning sessions.

sessions.title: Lunch & Panel Discussion
sessions.longDescription:
A Pizza lunch will be served. Food will be located just outside the meetings room. After getting your food, please take a seat back in the meeting rooms.

For today's lunch panel we have some of Ulta Beauty's leading digital experts.

We'll be taking questions from the audience, so please have some topics in mind.

sessions.title: Quality Assurance
sessions.longDescription: Successful testing is a key step to a successful app release and the final safeguard between your app and the end user.
takeaways: Ensure key user flows are identified and prioritized
Know your user base and their device preferences
Automation is important, but don't forget to look with your own eyes
iOS VIdeo Recording is a friend for all testers

sessions.title: Code Debugging
sessions.longDescription: Robert will be covering what debugging is, some techniques and approaches for effective debugging, and show an example of a common debugging scenario.
takeaways: Debugging is a process of solving a problem in an app
Debugging includes identifying a problem, isolating the source and then fixing it
Debugging can be made easier (or prevented) by using strategies such as unit testing, code reviews and beta testing.

sessions.title: Releasing an App
sessions.longDescription: We'll show you one of the final steps in the app development lifecycle by walking you through iTunes connect and what it takes to get your app there.
takeaways: Make sure your metadata and screenshots are ready prior to submitting to review
Take advantage of Phased releases

sessions.title: Q & A + Closing Statements
sessions.longDescription:
On behalf of the entire Ulta Beauty team, we thank you for attending our first ever Day of Code event.

We hope you all enjoyed the knowledge that we shared as much as we enjoyed delivering it to you.

Remember, it takes a village to build a mobile app and, potentially in the future, we might see you in ours.
